column1: full to start off, a bit of swing away towards the off stump, Rohit blocks off the front foot
full, straightening around off, pushed gently towards mid-off for a quick single
just back of a length, slanted across Dhawan's off-stump, holds its line and it's left alone
shortish, slanted across, Dhawan gets up on his toes to get on top of the bounce and taps it away to deep point
good length around off, Rohit brings the bat out to defend and gets an inside edge onto the thigh as it drops into the off side. Dhawan calls through for a quick one
nice and tight on off, on a length, Dhawan defends off the front foot
fuller around middle, curves in a tad and Rohit clips it to deep midwicket off the pads
length ball, slanted across in the corridor, Rohit gets a good stride across but is happy to let it go
fuller of a length, nips in from outside off, defended close to the pad down the pitch
full toss outside off, Rohit loses shape slightly as he drives and finds point
full and slanted across a set of stumps outside off, Rohit drives a tad uppishly to point
good length, swings back in too sharply and goes down leg with Rohit looking to glance it away
nice length around middle and off, straightens a bit and Rohit blocks it towards the midwicket region off the inside of the bat
length ball, slanted across off and given a bit of room, Dhawan punches it away with a half-angled bat through point
back of a length, this one comes on a little slow to him, Dhawan closes the face a little early and gets a leading edge into the off side
short around off, Dhawan arches back to give himself some space to free up those arms and laces the uppercut over the keeper for a six over third man
short of good length around middle, defended back
fullish length, leg stump lines, tucked around the corner for a single to fine leg
full, curving in towards off, pushed to mid-on
just back of a length, cuts away outside off, Dhawan reaches out and stabs it to point
full, angled in towards middle and swinging away late, Dhawan gets forward and carefully pushes it out to mid-off
back of a length, seaming away outside off, blocked late with an open face behind point
good length, angling in and this one holds its line, finds the inside edge of Dhawan's bat as he's defending on the front foot
full, bit of width outside off, Rohit reaches out without feet and gets a thick inside edge onto the back thigh
short of good length, angled across outside off, Rohit drops it behind point with an open face
length outside off, defended towards point
short of good length, angled in, tucked off the hips behind square leg
full, pushed across, reaches out and drills it to cover
length on middle, closes the face and tucks it away but can't beat midwicket
short, a bit of width, Dhawan cuts late but backward point gets down to his right to stop it clean
short around off, arches back a little and slaps straight to the point fielder this time
seams in off a length, Rohit tries to glance it away and ends up wearing it on the pad
full, comes down the track but it swings away a little and he reaches out to gently push it to point
short, again tries to arch back and ramp it over but this is too straight and too close to him. Also, the bounce is a little too much and he can't put bat to ball
fuller of a good length, swings away towards off, cautiously pushes it to extra cover. No run there

searing inswinger Dhawan has been trapped in front. Will he review? Nope, he walks off. Dhawan tries to close the face to clip it away but can't get underneath it as it's really full. Almost around the blockhole and he is pinned in front of middle and leg
back of a length on off, Gill shuffles across and solidly defends back down the pitch
back of a length, a bit of movement outside off, left alone
short of a length, opens up and carves a punch out through the gap between cover and point
fuller outside off, Gill gets a neat stride across and pushes it into the covers
good length, angling in towards off, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, gets forward and quietly pushes to mid-off
yorker, curving in towards off, jams the bat down to block it out
ripper!. On a length, forcing Rohit to bring the bat out and then seaming away subtly enough to nearly shave the outside edge
this one moves the other way, cuts back in off the seam but a little too much as it goes down leg
short of a length on off, defended down the pitch
short, pushed across off, gets on top of the bounce and blocks to point
full, curves in from outside off, pushed back to the bowler who gets down to his left and half-stops it
short of a length outside off, defended into the covers

gone! Rohit has been caught and bowled here and India are in a bit of trouble here. Remember, there's no Kohli. Swing does Rohit in. It's very full and swinging in sharply towards middle, Rohit half-pushes at it and ends up chipping it straight back at Boult to give him a dolly on the followthrough
nice and tight around off, defended
full, angling into middle, and Gill has his first international runs via a boundary - a nice wristy clip off the toes through square leg
full, swinging away, he's nowhere near it and ends up reaching out. But he goes at it with soft hands as he drives through the covers. The lack of power means it doesn't carry to the boundary
tucked to square leg for one
good length on off, defended
length ball, pretty wide outside off, left alone
short, angled across off, played with an open face to backward point who dives to make a save

short ball that pings him on the head. Gill shuffles across and takes a step back but ends up taking his eyes off the ball at the very end as he's swinging for a pull. Gets hit flush on the right side of the helmet. Whips it off and has a drink to regain his composure. Patrick Farhart, the physio is out to attend to him as well but he's good to go
full, angled across, reaches out and gets an inside edge to the right of the bowler
full, wide outside off and curving in, gets an inside edge to square leg
angles this in from outside off and he gets another inside edge into the leg side
short of a length, cuts away off the seam, loosely pokes at it and gets beaten
length but the umpire thinks it's way too wide
length around off, a bit of shape away, Rayudu pushes at it, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length outside off, flashes and flashes hard but ends up hitting it straight to Martin Guptill at short cover who times his jump to perfection to take it with both hands, Rayudu departs for a duck
length around off, a big stride forward and a solid defence
fuller outside off, once again a bit of away movement, pushes and gets beaten
and he edges this one behind, length ball around sixth stump line, Karthik follows it, gets an outside edge and Latham takes a regulation catch. India in trouble here
length, but way too outside off, left alone
short of length on the pads, flicked away but straight towards the square leg
fuller around off, driven but straight towards the bowler
short of length, into the body, defended from the back foot
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards square leg
short of length outside off, cuts it hard but straight to cover
length ball on the stumps, Gill plays it on the up, and straight to Boult, almost a replica of Rohit's dismissal, second caught and bowled for Boult
length outside off, left alone
length ball, nipping back in sharply to beat the bat, a loud appeal for lbw but that was heading down
length outside off, shaping away and given a wide
length around off, once again a hint of away movement, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, around fifth stump, left alone
back of length around middle, dabs it towards square leg
back of length outside off, tapped towards cover-point

a touch fuller than a length, swinging back and hitting the batsman on the front pad, up goes the finger, India want to review it, they have to. Pitched on middle, hit right in front of the middle stump and would have crashed into middle, three-fourth of the height
fuller, just outside off and swinging in, defended with half a foot forward
length, fifth stump line and once again shaping back, left alone this time
back of length on middle and leg and leaving the batsman, defended towards cover off the back foot
fuller outside off and a big swing in, Bhuvneshwar pushes it back towards the bowler
almost a yorker, the inswinging one, Bhuvneshwar jams his bat at it, an inside edge to backward square leg
length ball on middle and leg, and whipped past square leg by Pandya, off the mark with a stylish boundary
length again, much better line, around off stump and swinging in, drives on the up, the ball hits the inner half dribbles towards short midwicket
length outside off, looks to punch it through covers, an inside edge on to the pads
length ball just outside off, comes forward and defends
length around off, punched off the front foot but straight towards the bowler
length around off, punched again, this time towards mid-on
short ball, in two minds between getting under it and playing at it. He can't get anywhere near the top of it anyway and can't make contact as it goes over his shoulder
short ball, in two minds between getting under it and playing at it. He can't get anywhere near the top of it anyway and can't make contact as it goes over his shoulder
fuller, swinging in around off, whipped to midwicket
length ball, swinging in towards middle, Hardik barely defends in the nick of time to avoid the lbw
short of a length on off, defended off the backfoot into the off side
cuts him in half. Pushes a length ball across and it seams back in off the deck. Pandya is hanging his bat well away from his body and it rips past the inside edge
full outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
length ball outside off, holding its line, left alone
full outside off, pushed towards mid-off

goes straight through. De Grandhomme gets this nip back in just a tad. Bhuvneshwar does not move his feet much and has the bat hanging away from the body. That little gap is all the ball needs to sneak through and skid onto off stump. Series dominators in a deep, deep trench now
full, pushed across off, defended
length on middle and leg, tucked into the leg side
oh, that's a stunning shot. Flat over mid-on. A length ball on middle and leg and he presents the straightest of bats. Just presents the full face but there's enough power in it to go to the boundary
this one's fuller around off, and a lot more room as well. Pandya thumps it straight down the ground with immense power
short of good length, gets on top of the bounce and defends to point
short, sitting up around off, gets on top of the bounce and drags a pull from outside off over midwicket
another beauty! The off-cutter, at a short of good length, cuts away off the seam and beats the outside edge of his flashing bat
another ripper, 142kmph, breaking away off the deck and squaring him up as it shoots past the edge
length on middle and leg, defended back towards the bowler
a touch wider this time, and driven on the up, past the diving cover fielder for a couple
length outside off and swinging in, left alone
length, just around off, comes forward and taps it towards short midwicket
length outside off, comes forward and defends with an angled bat
fuller but near the tram line, given a wide
back of length on middle, defended on the leg side
length ball, pitching around middle and moving away to beat the bat, hits Pandya high on the back thigh
fuller on the stumps, Pandya goes for the flick and misses, but it was swinging down
slower one, fuller outside off, Pandya comes forward and drives it to cover
five-for for Boult. A short one has done the trick, was outside leg stump, Pandya fends at it, the ball brushes the gloves and lobs towards Latham behind the stumps
goes for an inswinging yorker, a touch too full, Chahal gets his bat down just in time
length ball on the stumps, Chahal was on the back foot but manages to defend it from there
short one from de Grandhomme, goes for the pull but fails to connect
length around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller this time, just around off, driven towards mid-on
length outside off, in the corridor, left alone
length again, much closer to the stumps this time, Kuldeep pushes at it and gets beaten
a touch fuller on the stumps, flicked away but Guptill makes a diving stop at square leg
back of length outside off, Chahal is not interested in chasing that one
length again, fifth stump line and moving away, beats the bat
just around off, and holding its line after landing, squaring Chahal up this time around
length, fourth stump line, Chahal pushes at it and gets beaten
yorker length outside off, Chahal jams his bat at it but once again no connection
length again, just outside off and moving after pitching to bat the bat
length ball, in the corridor and coming in with the angle, left alone
fuller outside off, driven through covers for a couple
pitched up outside off, Kuldeep drives it again, but straight to cover
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards square leg for one
length outside off, a little bit of swing still there, Chahal plays inside the line
length on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
back of length outside off, stays back and punches it to the left of third man, Todd Astle keeps it to one
length, fifth stump line and moving away, left alone
length outside off, comes forward and plays with an angled bat, a single to third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
short of length and Chahal goes for a pull, not in position at all, I must say. But the top edge flies over the keeper's head, one-bounce four
length outside off, comes forward and pushes at it, plays inside the line
length ball, pitching on the middle and moving away, beats the outside edge
short of length on the stumps, defended from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, and a wristy flick to beat the man at square leg for a boundary
length on middle and off, tapped towards short midwicket
a bouncer this time, goes for the pull, ends up lobbing it just over square leg
fuller outside off, goes for the drive, a thick outside off flies past the diving third slip, a single to third man
length ball, on middle and leg, looks to push it on the leg side, misses and gets hit on the thigh
length around off, comes forward and pushes it back towards the bowler
back of length on middle and leg, gets behind the line of the ball and blocks
a bouncer this time, Chahal goes for the pull and finds thin air
length outside off, leaving the batsman, Chahal was playing for the line and gets beaten
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it firmly towards extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
length around off, Kuldeep was pushing at it, the ball just holds its line and squaring the batsman up
fuller outside off, driven towards extra cover for a quick single
back of length around off, gets behind the line and defends
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it back towards the bowler
short of length on the hips and picked away towards square leg boundary
starts with a short of length ball on the stumps, defended on the leg side
length around off, goes back and tickles it towards fine leg
fuller around off, driven on the front foot, but the extra cover fielder intercepts
flighted around off, sharp turn and bounce to beat the bat
fuller this time, Chahal beats the extra cover fielder with the drive this time but sweeper cover cuts it off
a googly, pitching outside leg and spinning in just a little bit, defended from the crease
length outside off, around sixth stump and moving away, Chahal lets it go
length on the stumps, moves away, gets an outside edge past the second slip
short of length on middle and leg, pulls it towards deep backward square leg
fuller on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball around off, gets behind it and defends
back of length outside off, pushes it towards covers

ah, what do you know? It doesn't matter. Astle gets one to spin in sharply from a length outside off. Gets a bit of extra bounce as well. Kuldeep is down on one knee to sweep, gets a thick top-edge that sails into the hands of deep backward square
ah, most dicey leave of all time! This is the wrong'un, pitching well outside off. he's expecting it to leave him further. Instead it spins back and narrowly misses off stump
short of a length, big turn outside off, reaches out and can't make contact
dropped. Not much turn this time but Khaleel flashes hard without room and gets an edge that carries to Taylor's right but he spills it
pitched up on middle and leg, a bit of turn as well but he gets down for a slog against the turn and finds the deep square leg boundary
wrong'un, back of a length, punched in front of off on the backfoot
swept away, against the turn again, to deep square
full, angling into leg, driven back
full outside off, driven away to deep backward point
back of a length, outside off, backs away and keeps his bat inside
misfield at extra cover. Williamson lets this pass right through the legs as Khaleel drills this fuller one away

bowled him! India fold for 92, they have gone past their lowest score of 88 against NZ. But this has been quite the disaster for the visitors. This is a searing yorker, angling in, Khaleel jams the bat down and can't do anything about it as the ball sneaks underneath the bat and clatters onto the stumps
fuller on middle and leg, wristily whipped away over deep midwicket
fuller of a length this time, angling into Guptill again, shovelled through the left of mid-on
that's just sublime timing. No brute force this time, just a neat tuck off the pads to a length ball. These lines are too straight

and there it ends. A short-lived burst from Guptill. Didn't go hard at this one or anything. Just closed the face a tad early. This was fuller and angling in towards leg again. Probably stopped on Guptill a tad and he ends up closing the face early. Gets a leading edge to point. India strike early but one-seventh of the target has been shaved off just like that
back of a length on off, defended down the pitch
short of good length, cuts in off the seam towards off, Williamson gets an inside edge, lucky not to chop on
length ball around off, shuffles across and blocks
short on middle and leg, arches back and laces a pull behind square
full, angling in towards off, drilled to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
back of a length, comes on straight outside off, left alone
short of good length, shuffles across and defends. Khaleel has landed on the line. Or has he? Might have had something behind the line there. A marginal call
carved away over extra cover. Shifts back early in his crease and then frees his arms at the sight of width. Had to reach out really. Not pretty but effective
length ball around middle, defended
length ball, shapes away from around the sixth-stump channel, covers off stump and lets it go

good length, nips away from around middle a tad, Williamson i slightly squared up as he knocks it to point off the outside half of the bat. Rayudu slides to his right but can't get his hands to it, giving away an easy single
length ball around middle and off, pushed into the covers
good length outside off, gets a good stride forward and defends
length, angling in towards off, defended
good length outside off, sticks the bat out and gets beaten as it holds its line
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and defends
good length, cuts in from outside off and goes behind square leg off a thick inside edge
short, angled across off, Williamson gets up on the toes and slaps it through point
short of good length, angled in, tucked off the hips behind square leg
full outside off, driven to wide mid-off
fuller of a length, holding its line, left alone outside off
fullish, swings away outside off, left alone
fuller, this one angles in, Williamson clips it off the pads and finds square leg
good length on off, defended into the covers
length ball on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
length outside off, punched off the backfoot between cover and point. Both fielders give it chase but the ball wins the race
length around off, opens the face to gully
fuller of a length, nipping away from pretty wide outside off, left alone
short, angled in towards off from wide of the crease, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
short of good length around off, defended off the backfoot
fuller outside off, leans forward into a drive to point
back of a length outside off, defended
short of good length, nips away outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, defended late to point

edged and gone. Williamson's poor series continues. This is a length ball with a bit of width. Williamson is hanging the bat outside, perhaps looking for a dab through backward point. But he can't make up his mind and in the end decides to leave it. Too late, though, and he inadvertently gets an edge as he pulls the bat away and gets a nick through to DK behind the stumps
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and looks to play around the pad and closes the face. But gets pinged on the pad. Too high, though
walks half-forward and pushes at it but the ball seams in, cuts him in half and pins him high on the pad
length, curving in late from outside off, left alone
fuller on leg, perhaps pitched outside leg, Nicholls misses the flick and gets struck on the pad, a big appeal but given not out
length on middle and leg, pushed towards short midwicket
length outside off, angling across the batsman, left alone
fuller on the pads and flicked away, carries all the way, hitting the skirting on the full
length around off, a hint of swing back, defended with bat and pad close
short of length outside off, stays back and punches it towards mid-off
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, drives it past mid-off, Chahal with the chase keeps it to two
fuller around off, Taylor goes aerial, not from the middle of the bat but enough to clear Chahal at mid-off. Was more like a chip
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
length around off, coming in with the angle, Nicholls looks to punch it down the ground, misses and his struck high on the thigh
back of length around off, gets behind the line this time and defends it towards mid-on
length around off, punched towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball, down the leg side, looks to flick but misses, an appeal for caught-behind but perhaps it just brushed the pads
a touch fuller around off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller around off, punched towards mid-off
length, fourth stump line, looks to drive on the up and gets beaten
back of length on the stumps, punched back towards the bowler
starts with a leg-stump full toss, Taylor whips it towards the backward square leg boundary
fuller around off, pushed back towards the bowler
slower on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
flighted on the leg stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
back of length around middle and leg, goes back and punches it towards the right of Chahal
length on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg for one
short of length and pulled away but there is a man at deep square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven firmly but straight towards the bowler
short and some room outside off, cuts it past the backward point for a couple
length on middle and off, nipping back in to hit the batsman on the back thigh, looked like there was some inside edge as well
fuller outside off, gets forward and drives it through covers, all the way for a boundary
fuller, angled across the batsman who hangs his bat out and gets an inside edge to fine leg
flighted on the stumps, uses his feet to take it on the full and chips it just over the bowler's head
fuller on the stumps, goes down and paddles it towards fine leg
fuller outside leg, uses his feet to work it towards square leg
flatter outside off, spinning away, goes for the sweep but ends up playing over the ball
fuller on the stumps, clears his front leg and lofts it over deep midwicket for six
back to back sixes, this time via a slog sweep, was fuller around off and Taylor looks in a hurry
length around off and spinning away, left alone
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, sweeps it fine for a run
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length on middle and leg, flicked towards fine leg
length ball, pitching on off and spinning away, shouldered arms
fuller outside off, scythes it towards cover-point where the fielder dives to his right to make a partial stop
back of length on the stumps, punched towards long-on
fuller on the stumps and Taylor launches it over deep midwicket for his third six
short of length outside off, Taylor goes back and cuts it fine and those are the winning runs
